jobDescription: Job Summary:  Awesome Job: Data Engineer  Great Location: Hollywood, CA Who we are. We’re fans who help fans everywhere get in to the live events they love. A proud division of Live Nation Entertainment, Ticketmaster has changed the way the world connects with their favorite artists, teams, and shows, and we continue to shape innovation every day. We’re not just selling tickets (though we do that better than anyone else), we’re enriching lives one amazing experience at a time. And we think that’s pretty amazing. If you’re passionate about the magic of live entertainment like we are, and you want to work at a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want to hear from you. Why you should work with us. Our biggest investment is in our people. We offer comprehensive health benefits and 401k matching, student loan assistance, plus career-boosting opportunities like tuition reimbursement and targeted development sessions to help all eligible employees thrive. At Ticketmaster, expect the fast-paced excitement of a startup with the rock-solid support from an industry leader – with plenty of ticket perks on the side. See what it’s like working at Ticketmaster.The role: The LiveAnalytics group is looking for a Data Engineer to develop data products and services for Ticketmaster clients, write ad-hoc queries, and program next-generation data integration tools. This individual loves working with big data, has strong SQL skills, and enjoys finding innovative ways to solve complex business challenges. The ideal candidate is analytical and solution-oriented. He/she is a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. What the job is:Write, interpret, modify, and execute SQL queries for pulling and mining data sets from Ticketmaster’s enterprise data warehouseGenerate consumer profile and data audit reports for internal and external clientsParticipate in calls with Ticketmaster clients and partners to define project requirements, maintain specifications, and plan timelines. Communicate project updates to stakeholdersCreate custom data ETL processes leveraging AWS services, Ticketmaster APIs, and ETL tools using Java, Python, or other programming languagesDevelop jobs using Spark or Hive to process data stored on S3Work with 3rd party data providers and internal data engineering team to extract and deliver data assets, perform data quality validation, and streamline and automate processesManage server software to ensure optimal performanceManage Qlikview dashboards, including onboarding new clients, create dashboards from templates, design new dashboards, monitor data refreshes, and troubleshoot bugsSupport sales and implementation teams’ ad-hoc data requestsOther duties as assignedWhat a qualified candidate should possess:B.S. in computer science, statistics, economics or a related field3+ years of experience working with relational data, writing SQL queries, and developing reportsExperience with one or more programming languages (Java, Scala, Python, etc.)Familiarity with modern data computing topics such as web services, S3, distributed systems, etc.Eagerness to learn and work with open-source information technologies.Experience with advanced Excel features (vlookup, pivot tables, etc.)Ability to communicate analytical results and insights to less technical audiencesAbility to work with aggressive timelines and manage multiple priorities.Strong written and verbal communication skillsExperience with BI software (QlikView, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) is a plusExperience with open-source ETL tools (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.) is a plusExperience with Git or other version control systems is a plusEqual Employment Opportunity Ticketmaster strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), family and medical care leave or the denial of family and medical care leave, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), marital status, domestic partner status, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, military and veteran status, political affiliation, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship, race, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, and gender expression, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law, rule, ordinance or regulation.  We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, for applicants in Los Angeles, California, and consistent with applicable laws in other areas. Hiring Practices The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Ticketmaster recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Ticketmaster may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.
